data.title: John Shaw Bt (bef.1728-1779)
data.meta_description: Is this your ancestor? Explore genealogy for John Shaw Bt born bef. 1728 Eltham, Kent, England died 1779 Eltham, Kent, England including father + descendants + more in the free family tree community.
data.text:
[spouse(s) unknown]

Descendants

Profile last modified 25 Jun 2023 | Created 20 Jul 2022

This page has been accessed 152 times.

Contents

1 Biography

1.1 First Marriage

1.2 Second Marriage

1.3 Death

2 Sources

Biography

John Shaw Bt was born in Eltham, Kent, England.

John Shaw was baptised on 22 Nov 1728 at Elthan, Kent, England.

First Marriage

He married Elizabeth Hedges of Alderton, Wilts who died 3 Feb 1851, and

Second Marriage

He married secondly Martha Kenward (daughter of John Kenward of Kenward Park.) on 17 Feb 1752.

CHILDREN:

Sir John Gregory Shaw 5th Baronet Shaw of Eltham

John Barnardiston 1757-1757

Education

Sir John Shaw, 4th baronet Shaw of Elltham, graduated from Trinity College, Oxford with a Doctor of Civil Law.

He held the office of Sheriff of Kent from 1753 to 1754.

Death

Sir John Shaw, 4th Baronet Shaw of Eltham, passed away on 18 June 1779 at Eltham, Kent, England.

Sir John's second wife, Martha (Kenward) Shaw (1730-1794) , was buried 28 Oct 1794 at Eltham, Kent, England.

There is a painting of Sir John Shaw and his Family in the Park at Eltham Lodge, Kent, 1761, by Arthur Devis, who also did a painting of Sir John in 1757.

Each of his four sons was given the first name John.

Extract of Will Will of Sir John Shaw of Eltham Lodge , Kent, baronet, dated 27 May 1778, left property to trustees for son John Gregory Shaw and any son of his who reaches 21, wife Dame Martha, failing male heir of John Gregory to second son John Kenward Shaw and sons, failing this to daughter of John Gregory Shaw, and such daughter's spouse to take the name of Shaw. Very long details. Cover 14 pages.

LIST OF BARONETS[1]

First created on 15 Apr 1615

Sir John Shaw, 1st Baronet (c. 1615–1680) Commissioner of the Customs 1660–62 and Member of Parliament for Lyme Regis 1661–79.

Sir John Shaw, 2nd Baronet (c. 1660–1721)

Sir John Shaw, 3rd Baronet (1687–1739)

Sir John Shaw 4th Baronet (1728–1779)

Sir John Gregory Shaw 5th Baronet (1756–1831)

Sir John Kenward Shaw 6th Baronet (1783–1857)

Sir John Charles Kenward Shaw, 7th Baronet (1829–1909)

Sir Charles John Monson Shaw, 8th Baronet (1860–1922)

Sir John James Kenward Best-Shaw, 9th Baronet (1895–1984)

Sir John Michael Robert Best-Shaw, 10th Baronet (1924–2014)

Sir Thomas Joshua Best-Shaw, 11th Baronet (born 1965)

The heir apparent is the present holder's eldest son Joshua John Kirkland Best-Shaw (born 1995).

Sources

↑ Wikipedia - Best-Shaw baronets

PCC will 1778.
